📺 TV Technology Guide

Understanding OLED vs QLED vs Mini-LED

Display Technology Evolution

OLED
QD-OLED
Mini-LED
QLED
LED

OLED

Self-emitting pixels for perfect blacks

$599 - $3000+
Contrast100%
Brightness70%
Color95%

Pros

  • ✓Perfect blacks
  • ✓Infinite contrast

Cons

  • ✗Risk of burn-in
  • ✗Less bright than LED

Best for: Dark room viewing, movies, gaming

QD-OLED

OLED enhanced with Quantum Dots

$1500 - $4500+
Contrast100%
Brightness90%
Color100%

Pros

  • ✓Best color accuracy
  • ✓Brighter than OLED

Cons

  • ✗Most expensive
  • ✗Limited availability

Best for: Ultimate picture quality seekers

Mini-LED

Thousands of tiny LEDs for better control

$700 - $2500+
Contrast85%
Brightness95%
Color90%

Pros

  • ✓Very bright
  • ✓Great contrast

Cons

  • ✗Some blooming
  • ✗Not as good as OLED blacks

Best for: Bright rooms, HDR content, gaming

QLED

Quantum Dot enhanced LED

$300 - $1500+
Contrast60%
Brightness90%
Color80%

Pros

  • ✓Very bright
  • ✓Good colors

Cons

  • ✗Poor black levels
  • ✗Limited viewing angles

Best for: Bright rooms, budget conscious

LED

Traditional LCD with LED backlight

$150 - $600+
Contrast40%
Brightness75%
Color60%

Pros

  • ✓Most affordable
  • ✓Reliable

Cons

  • ✗Basic picture quality
  • ✗Poor contrast

Best for: Basic viewing, tight budgets

⚡ Quick Comparison

TechnologyBest ForPrice RangeKey Strength
OLEDDark room viewing, movies, gaming$599 - $3000+Perfect blacks
QD-OLEDUltimate picture quality seekers$1500 - $4500+Best color accuracy
Mini-LEDBright rooms, HDR content, gaming$700 - $2500+Very bright
QLEDBright rooms, budget conscious$300 - $1500+Very bright
LEDBasic viewing, tight budgets$150 - $600+Most affordable
